author: Kitty Legault
comment: The app works offline which is best for me. It lets you see all the buss stops around you and gives you the bus stop's number so you can text it for the information. If you have data, it aparently gets even better by giving you all that info right away~ overall, a good app that does what we need it to do~ Only petpeeve is the placement of the add when looking at the stop schedules as it hides the last one of the day.... which is kinda important when you think you missed the last but you didnt? And actually miss it because of it? ****needs to be fixed please and thank you :)

author: John Saber
comment: Update: it seems the issues have been fixed. The app is very snappy and responsive, and looks good to boot. Also, great job on the dev for replying quickly to feedback!  Original review: I like the look of the new update, but it is not working very well with me. Pretty much anything I try to do, I get an error saying "Oops, Unable to query data source". I tried using both Wifi and Data and nothing seems to work. I even tried reinstalling the app and still nothing.   It used to be great before this update, and I hope the problem can be solved.

reply.author: 3lywa Solutions
reply.content: There seems to be an intermittent issue with the data feed, seems like most third party apps are affected. We contacted OC.

author: Michael Bazdell
comment: Used to work. Randomly stopped being able to get any route information. Doesn't appear any way to find out why it's not working so I have to assume the app is at fault. When it did work, it would have problems every other week.

reply.author: 3lywa Solutions
reply.content: Hi Michael, thank you for your feedback. Oc transpo is currently experiencing some technical issues with their data feed that is causing all sort of issues for most bus apps. Please follow us on Twitter @TransitOttawato to get the latest updates.

comment: This was the best of the octranspo-tracking apps out there until the recent update. It's rare now that the app is able to query the GPS database. Seriously frustrating! Wait until this issue is fixed before you bother with this app.  The company keeps saying it is an Octranspo issue, but bottom line, this app, unlike others that can still query the database, isn't working.

reply.author: 3lywa Solutions
reply.content: Just wanted to let you know that the service is running as expected now that OC Transpo have fixed their server overload issue.

author: Mike M
comment: For some reason your widgets don't work on weekends. Works fine during the week, but as soon as weekends come your widgets become empty. And also this app needs to get android wear support with an app directly on android wear watch which is missing.

author: Monique Larson
comment: Love that I can see scheduled times while offline. The only issue is that some of the routes aren't showing up at stops I know they stop at, so I can't see gps data. (Example the 294, I can see the schedule in the app, but you can't find it at Greenboro or South Keys stops).

author: Michelyn St. Pierre
comment: I really liked it until these last updates. Now the crashing is fixed but it will still not bring up the route or bus stop schedule when i look it up.

reply.author: 3lywa Solutions
reply.content: Just wanted to let you know that the service is running as expected now that OC Transpo have fixed their server overload issue.

author: The00epyon
comment: It looks like they have worked out the "unable to query " issue. If this app works , it is very good for tracking buses and planning ahead

reply.author: 3lywa Solutions
reply.content: Unfortunately the issue has not been confirmed as fixed yet by oc transpo. We are still pushing to get this resolved asap

author: Drew MacDonald
comment: *UPDATE: As stated by the dev's reply, the most recent update fixed the crashing issues and the app is working great again. Changed my star rating back to 5.*

reply.author: 3lywa Solutions
reply.content: Please download the latest update as we fixed the crashes reported by Android 4.x :)

comment: This was the best app for routes, now I think it's the worse since the last update.  Unfortunately removing it cause it's just taking up space

reply.author: 3lywa Solutions
reply.content: Just wanted to let you know that the service is running as expected now that OC Transpo have fixed their server overload issue.

author: genetixs
comment: The issue seems to have subsided for now. But it was happening frequently before.

reply.author: 3lywa Solutions
reply.content: Hey, is this issue happening all the time? I'm able to get the data for stop 6730 at this time. If you encounter the message 'unable to query data source' then this would be related to the issue we've been having with oc transpo feed.

author: A Google User
comment: Best app for buses in Ottawa.  Sometimes it doesn't work properly, but I blame OC Transpo for that.

author: Rae MacKay
comment: Terrible app that doesn't work, however then again oc Transpo is the most unreliable , expensive, and CONSISTENTLY LATE AND UNRESPONSIVE transportation services so. I'm not that surprised their app sucks too.

author: A Google User
comment: Google maps app is better for getting around. This is good for checking route maps, schedules, etc. EDIT: I think this has improved. I like that you can see all of the busses at once rather than selecting each route to check what is coming next.

author: Patrick Gleason
comment: I am glad to see the rush hour issue was fixed. This is a very handy app. I use it several times a day!

reply.author: 3lywa Solutions
reply.content: Just wanted to let you know that the service is running as expected now that OC Transpo have fixed their server overload issue.

author: Cameron Steacy
comment: It seems everytime I need to use the app I get a blank page that says 'Oops!' as it can not load the pages. App seems to crash often

reply.author: 3lywa Solutions
reply.content: Hey Cameron, the "Oops, no service scheduled on xyz" indicates that the bus is not running for the selected date. Simply change the date to retrieve information about the requested bus. Please let us know if you have any questions.

author: Collin Pretty
comment: This app often fails to tell you the one thing you want to know when using it, when is my bus coming? Not that is doesn't try, it just isn't always accurate. I like how you can actually see where your bus is on the map, but again I doubt its accuracy. The app itself is clunky and doesn't have a good flow to it. I often find my self scrambling through the options and menu trying to see if I made it to the bus stop on time to catch my bus, or was I supposed to take the bus that's now pulling away as a back up... It can be very annoying that you can't actually do any trip planning with the app, there's no travel planner like on the OC Transpo site, nor can you see future bus times, to do it the old fashioned way.  It's been over 5 years since I had to last use this app and the busses in Ottawa for that matter, and I'm saddened to see the app hasn't changed at all.

author: Charles Soifer
comment: Useless. Inaccurate information on bus times. Displays random times that do not concide even remotely with published schedules. Not worth the 6mb of data

author: Laura Ye
comment: The bus time for one stop will show that the bus is scheduled to come in 16 minutes, yet the immediate next stop will show it's GPS tracked to come in 1 minute. No sure what's happening and the bus comes at neither of the times.
This app is awesome, however since the last update it won't even load the busses or the routes for the specific stops when you select a certain bus stop. Please fix!

reply.author: 3lywa Solutions
reply.content: Just wanted to let you know that the service is running as expected now that OC Transpo have fixed their server overload issue.
